Who can name which Harry Potter movie this spiral staircase was showcased in?!😍 One of the most beautiful Harry Potter filming locations was shot at St. Paul’s Cathedral in London 🇬🇧This was the staircase that students took up to Professor Trelawney’s Divination classroom in the Prisoner of Azkaban. 

✨The Spiral Staircase can only be accessed via the Public Triforium tour
✨ The tour lasts 1h and costs extra on top of the general admission 
✨ It is a great way to learn more about the history of St. Paul’s Cathedral, a peek behind the scenes, and access areas like the library aisle, the Trophy Room and the Great Model of the cathedral 
✨The best part of the tour is of course the spectacular view down from the top of the iconic Geometric Staircase 
✨ Book in advance because they take only a small group and tickets do sell out! We were super lucky that  our tour guide was so lovely and squeezed us onto the tour when we showed up only 5 min before it started 😂🙏🏻
✨ Note: it was quite challenging to take photos here. You have very limited time as you have to be chaperoned. The tour guides were so accommodating but there was only so much time we could spend there 

Would you visit here?

✨𝐓𝐨𝐩 𝟑 𝐇𝐨𝐠𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐏𝐡𝐨𝐭𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐲 𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬✨

The Harry Potter movies were filmed in a variety of beautiful locations across the UK 🇬🇧 Here are my top 3 favourite locations to shoot and give you a taste of what it’s like to be a Hogwarts student roaming around the castle! ❤️

📍Gloucester Cathedral
✨Hands down my favourite shooting location. The Romanesque/Gothic architecture is stunning and absolutely jaw dropping when you enter! 
✨ This is where many scenes from the Hogwarts Corridors were filmed including the writing on the wall in the Chamber of Secrets 

📍Christ Church College, Oxford 
✨ The Grand Staircase at Christ Church college is where we get one of our first glimpses of Hogwarts when the first-years enter for the first time!
✨ If you sleep over at the dorms in Christ Church you can get access at night for some epic moody shots!
✨ Extra bonus: you can also shoot the inspiration for the Great Hall while eating a full English breakfast 

📍 Durham Cathedral 
✨Steeped in history, Durham Cathedral was also used in the Harry Potter films for the beautiful Hogwarts Courtyard 
✨ The ancient cloisters were featured in iconic scenes like Harry letting loose Hedwig in the snow, and Dobby gaining his freedom from Lucius Malfoy 

Which one is your favourite?

Harry Potter fans! If you’re visiting Alnwick Castle where iconic scenes from the Harry Potter movies were filmed, then you have to stay at Hallow and Crux, a bed and breakfast where you can sleep like a wizard! [Hosted] 🧙🏻‍♂️⚡@hallowandcrux

✨Located in the heart of Alnwick in the Northumberland countryside, Hallow & Crux is a Harry Potter-inspired Bed and Breakfast and the perfect magical stay 🪄
✨ The B&B is located literally steps away from Alnwick Castle, where iconic scenes were filmed: the flying lessons, the route to Hagrid’s Hut, and the Ford Anglia crashing into the castle grounds.
✨There are 4 boutique bedrooms each designed with a magical theme: The Common Room, The Dumbledorm, The Marauders, and The Chambers
✨We stayed in the Chambers, a nod to those stylish Slytherins. The room was extremely spacious, made in a Victorian style but with a contemporary feel. Love the high ceilings, wooden beams, sconces, and beautiful decor! 🐍
✨Breakfast is included in the Award winning restaurant & bar, The Dirty Bottles, that’s located in the adjoining building. The breakfast had a diverse menu, but we chose to have the Full English, which was scruptious!! 😋
✨The FOOD! The Dirty Bottles was an amazing restaurant. I would go back just for the food! Portions were huge at a great price, and excellent quality. We had dinner, breakfast, and lunch there and every meal was fantastic (hands down one of the best meals of our trip)🍴

📍 Hallow & Crux, Alnwick, UK 🇬🇧

Definitely make Hallow & Crux part of your magical adventure! It was truly a magical stay 🫶🏻

Did you know there’s an official Harry Potter cafe in Tokyo, Japan? 🇯🇵 This stunning location in Akasaka offers photo-worthy dishes and magical drinks inspired by the wizarding world 🪄

Here’s what we tried:
✨ Drinks: We chose the Patronus and Wingardium Leviosa non-alcoholic cocktails because they were the prettiest 😂 We enjoyed the flavours! 🍸
✨ Starter: The Golden snitch avocado shrimp (great presentation)
✨Mains: The Hogwarts Sunday Roast was Instagram-worthy with the fancy smoke, and the pork chop and mash were flavourful (would recommend!); The Slytherin Cheese toastie with smoked salmon was cute but we preferred the roast 
✨ Dessert: Hedwig cake - super cute and kind of like an Asian tiramisu (the majority of the decor is whipped cream though!) 🦉

Overall, the food was well presented and the atmosphere was immaculate. The prices were reasonable but if you’re a hardcore foodie, you may prefer eating traditional Japanese food in Japan, but this was an experience like none other.  I would recommend trying at least once if you are a Harry Potter fan since it was a fun experience, and it’s located in the Harry Potter plaza in Akasaka, right next to Mahou Dokoro (awesome Harry Potter shop), the Cursed Child, and the Akasaka Station which was transformed into a Hogwarts Hall! ✨

Foodie adventure inspired by @themagicalblonde ✨

📍 Harry Potter Cafe, Tokyo, Minato City, Akasaka
🎟️ Online reservation required. Make sure you book in advance!

Would you go here? 🪄

Here is Part 1 of my Ultimate Harry Potter Trip Itinerary! 🪄We embarked on a 2-week road trip across the UK from London to Scotland, hitting all the Harry Potter film locations, inspired places behind the series, magical stores, and Harry Potter themed accommodations! ⚡🇬🇧 I’ve broken down the route we took (which you can do either by car or train):

DAY 1: Cotswolds
✨Castle Combe: early morning views of the English countryside to get taste of a classic Cotswolds village
✨Lacock Village: iconic film locations at Lacock Abbey, such as the Hogwarts halls and classrooms, plus Lily + James’ house, Slughorn’s Hideaway and more
✨Stow-on-the-Wold: iconic Tolkien inspired door at St. Edwards Church 

DAY 2: Gloucester/Oxford
✨ Gloucester Cathedral for the most beautiful view of Hogwarts corridors
✨ Oxford in the afternoon for a tour of the Bodleian Library and Divinity school (where the restricted section and infirmary were filmed) 🚨Book early!
✨ Sleep over at Christ Church college to roam the halls of Hogwarts at night
✨ Bonus: If you have time, squeeze in Bleinhem Palace Gardens to see Snape’s tree before or after leaving 

DAY 3: OXFORD/YORK
✨Eat a Full English Breakfast in the Great Hall (included if you stay at Christ Church AirBnB)
✨Explore New College Oxford in the morning to see Draco Malfoy’s tree and courtyard
✨Head to York in the afternoon and visit the Shambles (real life Diagon Alley)
✨Sleep over in a magical AirBnb @101houseattheend ,a real life 12 Grimmauld Place

I know a lot of you were asking me to share our route, so hopefully this is helpful! Feel free to jig things around as you wish. We were very ambitious squeezing in everything in 2 weeks, so definitely some parts would be nice to have spent longer visiting. Follow for Part 2! 🙌🏻✨

#hogwarts #hogwartsismyhome #oxford #beautifuldestinations #harrypotter #harrypotterfan #visitengland #uniquegetaways #bookstagram #harrypotterfilm

Harry Potter fans! Here are the Top 5 Must-Do Experiences at Warner Bros. Studio Tour Tokyo that you can’t get anywhere else!! 🪄🙌🏻 @wbtourtokyo 

✨ See the moving staircases and make your own moving Hogwarts portrait! 
✨ Use the Floo Network and visit the Ministry of Magic
✨ Visit the stunning Hogwarts Library for some “light” reading 
✨ Cheer on your favourite Quidditch team and see what it’s like to become an extra on film!
✨ Catch the mini show where you learn how to duel a Death Eater during your Defense against the Dark Arts class (we almost missed this as we didn’t speak Japanese!)

The scale and detail of WB Tour Tokyo was beyond one’s imagination!! It felt like twice the size of WB Tour London with tons of authentic props, life size sets (including new ones like the Ministry of Magic) and behind the scenes movie making magic! What really impressed us was the amount of fun interactive spots that made you feel like you were part of the movie magic 🥹❤️ 

Follow for more magical adventures! ✨

Welcome to Part 1 of our second magical room transformation! ✨ Join me as I put up wallpaper from @lovevsdesign which completely elevated the look of our guest room and gave us the whimsical Woodland/English countryside look that we are going for! ❤️ | AD-pr

✨ Love vs. Design offers removable wallpapers that are completely customizable 🎨
✨ I was surprised by how easy it was to custom create the wallpaper. You can choose from a variety prints and do any colour combo you want! 
✨ It was also super easy to decide how much wallpaper to order. Simply input the dimensions of your wall and @lovevsdesign will calculate how many rolls you need!
✨ Choose Peel and Stick Wallpaper or traditional wallpaper that requires no paste. Three paper types available: smooth, woven, and glissade.
✨ We went with “Glissade” which involved traditional wallpaper that required no paste. All you had to do was spray with water, stick, and smooth it on!

Installing wallpaper is always an ordeal and this was the second time that I’ve tried it! I pretty much did the whole process on my own! The first couple of panels are always the hardest and time consuming until you get the hang of it. But @lovevsdesign took out the step of requiring paste which was time saving! It took me 5 hours this time vs 12 hours 😂 

Stay tuned for more of my magical room transformation and details on how we are styling it! This is the Guest Room but I honestly will probably end up sleeping in it since I love it so much. We are going for a Forbidden Forest/Woodland/English Countryside theme. Basically a not so dark Forbidden Forest 😆 What do you think so far?!

✨ You can also shop exclusive Tully HP merch (available online as well)

What You Need to Know about Hippogriffs:
✨ They’re proud
✨ They’re easily offended
✨ Never insult one (‘cause it might be the last thing you do)
✨ Always wait for the hippogriff to make the first move
✨ Try not to blink when facing one
✨ Never pull any of the feathers, they won’t like it

social_posts.post_text:
Come with me to have a Harry Potter themed Afternoon Tea with Professor Umbridge at @wbtourtokyo 🪄🍰☕ You may not like her, but you can’t deny she’s got style! We absolutely loved this experience!! 😋

✨Try a bunch of savoury and sweet treats with a magical twist, including freshly baked scones, and fun treats like the ‘Golden Snitch Cream Puff’, ‘Kitten Rare Cheese Mont Blanc’ and ‘Punishment Brownie’ 🍰

✨ The afternoon tea started off with a bang with a magical color-changing “Colovaria Tea”; this was a neat and interactive idea ☕️🫖

✨ All-you can drink tea and non-alcoholic beverages. We got to try different teas and fun sparkling drinks 🍸

✨ The presentation was 10/10. Everything was so cute and the theme-ing was on point! Nice touches included a Kitten-style dessert and a brownie that said “I must not tell lies” 🐈

✨ Dine in Umbridge’s office; the venue was so aesthetic with the pink tufted couches and moving cat plates on display! And don’t forget to look up and spot Dolores Umbridge spinning around above you! 💕

✨Not only did it look good, but the food was actually incredible!!! We were very impressed by the quality. We left feeling full! 🥰

✨Note: Subject to Availability; No reservations are taken in advance! Located in the Backlot Cafe at the midway point of the tour, you have sign up at 11 a.m. We made a beeline for this to make sure we got a spot!

🛒 Fees: 6,500 yen/person (incl. tax)
(This meal was not sponsored and opinions are my own)

📍Warner Bros. Studio Tour Tokyo, Japan 🇯🇵

I never knew being in Umbridge’s office could be such a delightful experience! 😆 The food and tea were phenomenal. We loved it so much and would do it again! 🙌🏻 I 💯 recommend this experience if you have a chance at your next visit to Warner Bros Studio Tour in Tokyo!

Here is Part 2 of my Ultimate Harry Potter Trip Itinerary! 🪄We embarked on a 2-week road trip across the UK from London to Scotland, hitting all the Harry Potter film locations, inspired places behind the series, magical stores, and Harry Potter themed accommodations! ⚡🇬🇧 I’ve broken down the route we took (which you can do either by car or train):

DAY 4: Goathland 
✨Goathland Station: Watch a steam engine go by at the real life Hogsmeade train station 🚂

✨ Visit the historic Durham Cathedral cloisters and courtyard where iconic scenes like Hedwig taking flight in the snow and Dobby being set free were filmed 

✨ Make your way north to Alnwick and stay in an award winning Harry Potter themed bed and breakfast at @hallowandcrux

DAY 5: Alnwick Castle/ Edinburgh
✨Eat a Full English Breakfast at Hallow & Crux 
✨Explore Alnwick Castle located steps away in the morning and take flying lessons 
✨ Iconic scenes at Alnwick Castle: Remembrall scene, whomping willow, route to Hagrid’s 
✨Head to Edinburgh in the afternoon 
✨ Afternoon tea at The Witchery 

DAY 6: Edinburgh 
✨ Tour this historic and magical city that inspired the story of the Boy who Lived 
✨ Visit inspirational locations like Greyfriars Kirkyard, Victoria Street, and Elephant House 

This is a roadmap for your next ultimate Harry Potter trip! Note: feel free to do this at your own pace if you have the luxury of time. Follow for Part 3! 🙌🏻✨

✨ Orlando Informer Meetup✨

We had a blast at the latest Orlando Informer Meetup! 🙌🏻 If you don’t know what that is, it’s the best event at Universal Orlando! 😄@orlandoinformer | ad-pr 

Here is why you should come to an Orlando Informer Meet Up:

✨ After hours access to both parks from 5 pm to past midnight (1230am on Friday and 130am on Saturday)
✨ Smaller crowds and short wait times for rides! 🙌🏻
✨UNLIMITED food and non alcoholic drinks! This is the best time to try food around the parks 
✨ Try all the magical drinks in the Wizarding World and have unlimited Butterbeer! 🍻
✨ All you can eat ice cream at Florean Fortescue!! We tried every flavour. My favs are strawberry and peanut butter and apple crumble 
✨ Experience an empty Diagon Alley 🐉
✨Fav foods this year: Shepherds Pie and Pea Salad at the Leaky Cauldron; Philly Steak at Minions Cafe; and Banana Toffee Bread Pudding at Finnigan’s 🍰
✨ Access discounted Universal hotel prices if booking through Orlando informer
✨ $15 gift card that can be used anywhere in the parks and doesn’t expire (we used it for lunch the next day)

🛒 $234 for Fri $244 for Sat, or $405 for both nights + tax; early bird discounts apply; February tickets are out now!! 

🚨It’s open to everyone, but reserve your tickets early because this event sells out
🔹 OI Meet Up happens 4 times a year: February, June, November, and  December 
 
Thank you @orlandoinformer for inviting us! 🥰 it was an unforgettable experience. Are you ready to come to the next Orlando Informer Meetup?! 🙌🏻❤️

Christmas in the Wizarding World 🪄🎄Christmas is my favourite time of year to visit @universalorlando 🥹 Here’s why:

✨Hogsmeade and Diagon Alley look extra magical with the lights and Christmas decor. Take a closer look at the unique garlands and decor associated with each shop! 🫶🏻
✨ Special Christmas shows like Christmas songs sung by Celestina Warbeck and the Toad Choir
✨ Step outside the Wizarding World to watch Grinchmas!! Best Christmas show at @universalorlando

Hi, I’m Candice and I was having a good hair day here 🙋🏻‍♀️😆 Hopping onto this trend since there’s a lot of new faces! Welcome to my little magical corner of the internet and thanks for stopping by! 🫶🏻

✨ I started this account 3 years ago ft myself and my brother on our wizarding adventures. It’s a whole family affair as we all love HP (we’ve finally converted my husband though he won’t admit it!) You will see cameos of them from time to time as they are super supportive! ❤️

✨ Harry Potter has always been a huge part of my life but outside of my family I never really had anyone to share it with. Now I’ve found this incredible community on Pottergram with people who share the same passion for the story and a place where we can express ourselves fully! 🙌🏻

✨ I have a full time job in the mental health field. This account is a hobby and a means of escape (and probably my own therapy). It honestly takes up more time than my actual job 😂

✨ I’ve always been interested in photography since I was a kid. Even in elementary school I was the one with the film camera and would document EVERYTHING! 📸 So branching into social media was a natural extension of what I’ve always been doing. My parents and even my grandma were also the OG vloggers back in the day so I think taking pictures/video is part of my genetics and I can’t help it 😂 My biggest pet peeve is when people scold and say “look with your eyes”- I think that’s 💯 incorrect. Photography allows one to look at the world through a different perspective and allows you to appreciate details that may typically go unnoticed 

✨ My other great passion is travel, esp adventure travels, usually involving some sort of hiking and camping. I truly enjoy suffering on a trip as it adds an element of fun and it feels good to know that your mind and body accomplished something 💪🏻@rx_for_travel 🌎

✨ I also love reading. Mainly fantasy. I’m a huge LOTR fan and now very into fantasy romance: ACOTAR, FBAA, The Cruel Prince etc with some 🌶️

Thank you all for your ongoing support!! Let me know something about yourself down below! 👇🏻❤️

✨Top 7 Iconic Harry Potter Items ✨

When I think of each Harry Potter book/film, a powerful object always comes to mind. Here are my Top 7 iconic pieces in Harry Potter from @thenoblecollection that correspond to each storyline 🪄 

✨ The Philosopher’s Stone
The Philosopher’s stone is a legendary alchemical substance with magical properties used to transform any metal into gold and can create the Elixir of Life, making the drinker immortal.

✨ The Sword of Gryffindor
The sword of Gryffindor was made a thousand years ago by goblins, and was owned by Godric Gryffindor. Harry first used it to slay the Basilisk and later hunt Horcruxes. 

✨ The Time Turner
A Time-Turner was a magical device used for time travel. Hermione received special permission to use it to manage her  immense workload. It was then used to save Sirius Black and Buckbeak. 

✨ The Golden Egg
The golden egg was the goal of the First Task of the Triwizard Tournament and held the clue to the Second Task.

✨ The Prophecy Orb
The Hall of Prophecy was a chamber within the Department of Mysteries at the Ministry of Magic. Each glass orb contained a prophecy; this one in particular belonged to Harry Potter and was predicted by Sybill Trelawney.

✨ Slughorn’s Hourglass
The sand in Professor Slughorn’s Hourglass ran accordingly with the quality of the conversation: if stimulating, the sand ran slowly.

✨ Ravenclaw’s Diadem
A tiara owned by Rowena Ravenclaw and said to grant wisdom to the wearer. It was lost for centuries before it became a Horcrux.

QOTD: Which one is your favourite? What magical object comes to your mind when you think of each book/film? 👇🏻

✨Hogwarts Library: My Harry Potter Textbooks✨

I was in the library the other night for a bit of light reading…If anyone asked about the most cherished items in my Harry Potter collection, it would be these replica textbooks. I would run into a fire to save them. ❤️📚

These are fan-made, incredibly detailed and phenomenally created to look like they were plucked off screen. And you can read them cover to cover. I’ve featured a few of them before but finally, here is my long awaited video of all of my Hogwarts replica textbooks together! 🫶🏻🥹

🐍𝐒𝐥𝐲𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧 𝐀𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐜🐍

“𝘖𝘳 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘚𝘭𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯, 𝘺𝘰𝘶’𝘭𝘭 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘭 𝘧𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘴, 𝘵𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘦 𝘤𝘶𝘯𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘭𝘬 𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴, 𝘵𝘰 𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘦𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘴,” 𝘴𝘢𝘪𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘏𝘢𝘵. 

Channeling my inner Slytherin in one of the most fun shoots we’ve done so far! Check it out…we have our very own Nagini 🐍 Full disclosure: I swear I am a Gryffindor! 😆🦁 But I have to say that the Slytherin aesthetic is on point and the lure to go over to the Slytherin side was definitely strong that day 🤪 

It was so much fun playing with my friends’ pet snake Spots, who stole the show! 🥰 Spots is a 5ft-long Ball Python. He had a great personality and was having the time of his life slithering around outside of his cage! My Gryffindor traits won out and I surprisingly was not scared at all, though as it was my first time working with Spots, I was very careful to not make any sudden movements or scare him. I learned so much about snakes that day and now understand the fascination with these majestic creatures! I hope to do more shoots with Spots in the future! 🐍 Big thank you to my Slytherin friends for letting me play with Spots! 🙏🏻❤️
